about.title: About Me
about.content: Highly motivated Electronics and Communication Engineering student seeking an internship to apply and expand technical skills in embedded systems, signal processing, and network engineering. Eager to contribute to innovative projects and gain practical industry experience. Familiar with C, Python, Java, and with growing proficiency and a strong academic foundation. Passionate about continuous learning and staying at the forefront of technological advancements.

items.description:
- Designed and implemented responsive user interfaces using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
- Used Git and GitHub for version control and collaborative development.
- Attended regular team meetings and sprint reviews (if part of an agile setup).
- Documented project progress and technical decisions.
- Participated in code reviews and followed best practices for clean, maintainable code.

items.title: Indoor Air Quality monitoring system
items.description: This monitors the Air quality and alerts the people about the temperature, airquality, humidity with both alarm and led indication.

items.title: ⚙️ How It Works
items.description:
- The MQ-135 sensor outputs an analog voltage based on gas concentration.
- The DHT sensor provides temperature and humidity readings.
- Arduino reads these values, categorizes air quality (e.g., Good, Poor, Toxic), and displays them.
- You can set thresholds to trigger alerts via buzzer or LEDs.
